data.title: Paulo Moura on LinkedIn: Money 2020 Bangkok 23
data.meta_description: Passion is the key to success, and it seems like Paulo Moura has found his passion! After exploring fraud prevention and fintech, he has now found another…
data.text:
"𝗪𝗲 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗮 𝗱𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝘁 𝟵.𝟯𝟬𝗮𝗺." "Money20/20 is different from the other events. We have the right partners, at the right place." "The whole ecosystem is here, all the decision makers are here. I can get all my meetings done within just one day." "The right partners in the right place." "It's beyond my expectations" "This is my favourite event. You can see the energy here." "Where else would you get this opportunity" Money20/20 𝗔𝘀𝗶𝗮 𝗶𝘀 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝟮𝟮 - 𝟮𝟰 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱. Meet the most senior decision makers from the entire Asian money ecosystem under one roof over three days of serious business opportunities. DM me now here on LinkedIn, or drop me a note to neil@money2020.com to find out how your company can be saying similar things in 2025. Featuring: SHIELD, LianLian Global, HSBC, PT. Mandiri Capital Indonesia (MCI), Bitkub, #money2020asia #fintech #bfsi #payments

The latest Money20/20 Asia keynote speaker has landed. Daranee Saeju, Assistant Governor, Payment System Policy and Financial Consumer Protection Group at the Bank of Thailand. A banking veteran on both the policy front and a practitioner on the implementation front. Dr. Saeju has worked extensively on monetary policy implementation, foreign exchange operations, and central bank acts and was even once seconded as an expert to the International Monetary Fund (IMF)! She's played a key role in Thailand's rise as a leader in Southeast Asia's rapidly growing fintech ecosystem. Including the development of the world's first linkage of faster payment systems through PromptPay & PayNow, and QR code payment linkages with 6 countries (the highest number of cross-border real-time payment linkages globally). She joins our powerhouse speaker roster, with 120 speakers already confirmed (we will have 200+ at the show) to take to the stage at Money20/20 Asia (23 - 25 April, 2024, Bangkok) including: 1) Speakers from 20 countries, 13 APAC countries 2) Over 30 of APAC's largest payment companies 3) A diverse range of over 25 banks 4) 12 unicorns and counting 5) 5 confirmed keynotes And you can shave $500 off your #Money2020Asia pass... But not for long! Prices jump after this week, 12 Jan. So move fast. #fintech #money #money2020asia P.s. > Link to see our first 120 speakers in the comments below

At this year’s Money20/20 Europe, Alan Cuschieri, governor of FinanceMalta, sat down with us to discuss Malta’s rapid rise as a fintech powerhouse. This interview shines a light on: ✅What makes Malta an attractive destination for fintech companies. ✅How the regulatory framework supports innovation in this industry. ✅FinanceMalta’s role in promoting and supporting fintechs. ✅Opportunities and challenges for fintechs wanting to operate in Malta. ✅How the Malta fintech sector will evolve in the next 5 to 10 years. Read more here: https://hubs.li/Q02JdfBB0 to find out how Malta is fast becoming a hotbed for innovation. #malta #financialservices #fintech #money2020

And that’s a wrap at Money20/20 Asia! Only their second event in the region but the bar has been set v high and it will no doubt establish itself very quickly alongside 🇺🇸/🇪🇺 editions. 🙌🙌 As always, great to connect with old friends, make new ones and in this case meet a long lost family member! My key takeaways: 🚧🚧The many options for digital bank builders were on show! Banks can go independently with core platform providers (eg Thought Machine, Mambu 10X), use BaaS (eg audax, engine) or through strategic drag/drop (eg WeLab Bank in Indonesia). The likely outcome: lower cost/higher speed to market/greater innovation. Exciting times! 💵📲Embedded finance is making great progress in the region (APAC likely to be ~50% of global EMFI revenues next year). Regional Open banking (so far!) remains more of a vision than a reality although some success stories beginning to emerge (eg cross border QR payments). Lots of energy on show at M20/20 in this space, particularly in payments. 🧠The genAI hype train was relatively restrained. Widespread agreement that it will be a huge step forward in many areas. But almost everyone I spoke with acknowledged that running tools in prod is a challenge still to be conquered. Expect lots of live use cases next year. Trust Bank Singapore Bernard Woodruff Nektarios Liolios Fernn Lim Kelvin Tan Matej Ftacnik Malcolm Macnaughtan Jessica Lam Simon Beitz Florian Becker Jason Ng Meenu Mishra Dan J. Shivani Mukherjee Nick Drewett Sona Raichoora Olivier Berthier Barbaros Uygun 胡博思 David Walker 戴瑋安 Alex Manson Trisha Yeong Zennon Kapron Ben Sadeghi Rene Michau #Money2020 #FintechInnovation #DigitalTransformation

Our Chief Growth Officer Puneet Chopra, will be speaking at MWC Kigali this year, starting from the 16th of October. The Panel will discuss: Unlocking Fintech Innovation and Opportunities. Date: Wednesday, 18th October. Time: 11:30 to 12:45 CAT. Session overview: Industry experts will share key insights into the current trends in fintech and how key business partners are leveraging the opportunities and overcoming the challenges they create. Across the globe new propositions are launched on a weekly basis and scaled solutions now in market that had barely launched 5 years ago. The mobile eco-system is powering many of these trends. In our last session we will review some of these global trends with experts who are at the leading edge of the latest thinking and explore how they are creating new opportunities. See you there. #fintech #innovation #paneldiscussion

In case you missed it, the Money20/20 Asia call for content went live last week and is open until the 2nd October. This is your opportunity to address a captivated audience, share your valuable expertise, and weave your story into the fabric of Asia's #1 show for money. In 2024, our Money20/20 Asia programme will delve into the ‘Now’ and ‘Next’ of fintech in Asia through the three conference themes: 1) Integration: Breaking Down Barriers, Creating Opportunities 2) Virtualisation: The Rise of Digital Finance 3) Eastward Expansion: Asia's Fintech Frontier You’ll be in great company speaking alongside 200+ rockstars of Asian fintech, including: 1) Martha Sazon, President & CEO, GCash 2) Farhan Ahmad, Group CEO, PAYNET (Payment Network of Malaysia) 3) Topp Jirayut Srupsrisopa, Founder & Group Chief Executive Officer, Bitkub Capital Group Holdings If you're planning on applying to be on our legendary stages, now is the time to think about how you want your brand to show up throughout the whole event, on and off the stage. If you’re selected you’ll benefit from: 1) Joining the elite, we have 1000+ applications to speak and only 200 speaking slots up for grabs 2) Being recognised for the work you are doing, you’ll be speaking in front of fintechs most important Asian and global audience 3) Expanding your professional network, break the ice at scale and kick start your next business opportunities Do you have a story to tell? The link to submit your application is in the comments below. #money2020 #fintech #thoughtleadership

The movement of people and goods on the African continent, as well as a push for greater regional trade, is creating the need for simpler and more affordable forms of payment. -------- #BDSpotlight PODCAST | Africa’s growing cross-border fintech market Tendai Tizirai Ngandu, market development manager at Mukuru, talks to us about Africa’s growing cross-border money transfer market. Mukuru is a financial technology (fintech) platform in Southern Africa that specialises in cross-border payments and remittances. It has a customer base of more than 13-million across 50 countries in Africa, Asia and Europe. The discussion includes the state of remittances on the continent; regulations and how money is flowing in Africa; the importance of financial inclusivity; a closer look at Mukuru’s new naira bank top-up feature; and the benefits of simplifying the money-transfers process. LISTEN https://lnkd.in/gBvtHcvT via Business Day on BusinessLiveSA
